name: Dance
description: Rooted in Disco and developed largely within Electronic Dance Music; emphasizes rhythm and is generally produced for play by DJs at clubs, parties, or festivals.

sub_genres.name: Alternative Dance
sub_genres.description: Incorporates rhythms and synthesizers from Electronic Dance Music within the context of Alternative Rock and related styles; predominantly popular in the 1990s.

sub_genres.name: Dance-Pop
sub_genres.description: Simple, yet catchy melodies and throbbing beats inspired initially by Disco and later various House styles.

sub_genres.name: Disco
sub_genres.description: Combines the lush orchestration of Philly Soul and bass grooves of Funk with a four-on-the-floor rhythm.

sub_genres.name: Electronic Dance Music
sub_genres.description: Broad category for subgenres mainly derived from Disco, featuring Electronic sounds, synthesizers, drum machines and varying BPM ranges.

sub_genres.name: Miami Bass
sub_genres.description: Sustained Roland TR-808 kick drums and faster tempos, along with a distinct Electro influence.

sub_genres.name: Wa Euro
sub_genres.description: Traditional form of J-Pop that emerged in the second half of the 1980s from late Hi-NRG, '80s British Dance-Pop and Italo-Disco/Eurobeat.
